ai-patthana18.8:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma, third in the place he had allowed to,
ai-patthana18.8:0.3_0: Approaches on the causes and reasons in order to show (?) sights, etc.
ai-patthana18.8:1.1_0: it should be given up without seeing a cause, without reason, because of not seeing the reason, with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana18.8:1.1_1: ‘... for the sake of conditioned things.’ ...
ai-patthana18.8:1.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.8:2.1_0: One should not give up a teaching without seeing, without cause, with no reason.
ai-patthana18.8:2.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.8:3.1_0: The cause should be given up only by developing the reason for the development of the base consisting of development, no cause or condition.
ai-patthana18.8:3.1_1: ‘... for the sake of conditioned things.’ ...
ai-patthana18.8:3.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.8:4.1_0: You shouldn’t give up any things that shouldn’t be given up in developing the Teaching.
ai-patthana18.8:4.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana18.8:5.1_0: it should be given up without cause or reason.
ai-patthana18.8:5.1_2: Five or five reasons to touch them ...
ai-patthana18.8:5.1_3: the five hindrances are not clear.
ai-patthana18.8:6.1_0: without seeing the cause, without reason, because of not seeing the reason,
ai-patthana18.8:7.1_0: Because of developing a teaching that causes and conditions for the sake of developing the development of the path that arises with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana18.8:7.1_2: Five or five reasons to touch them ...
ai-patthana18.8:7.1_3: the five hindrances are not clear.
ai-patthana18.8:8.1_0: You shouldn’t give up any cause or reason for developing the teaching, nor for the sake of developing it.
ai-patthana18.8:8.1_3: This is the section in brief.
